bag_to_csv.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 '''
2 This script saves each topic in a bagfile as a csv.
3 
4 Accepts a filename as an optional argument. Operates on all bagfiles in current directory if no argument provided
5 
6 Written by Nick Speal in May 2013 at McGill University's Aerospace Mechatronics Laboratory
7 www.speal.ca
8 
9 Supervised by Professor Inna Sharf, Professor Meyer Nahon
10 
11 '''
12 
13 import rosbag, sys, csv
14 import time
15 import string
16 import os #for file management make directory
17 import shutil #for file management, copy file
18 
19 #verify correct input arguments: 1 or 2
20 if (len(sys.argv) > 2):
21  print "invalid number of arguments: " + str(len(sys.argv))
22  print "should be 2: 'bag2csv.py' and 'bagName'"
23  print "or just 1 : 'bag2csv.py'"
24  sys.exit(1)
25 elif (len(sys.argv) == 2):
26  listOfBagFiles = [sys.argv[1]]
27  numberOfFiles = "1"
28  print "reading only 1 bagfile: " + str(listOfBagFiles[0])
29 elif (len(sys.argv) == 1):
30  listOfBagFiles = [f for f in os.listdir(".") if f[-4:] == ".bag"] #get list of only bag files in current dir.
31  numberOfFiles = str(len(listOfBagFiles))
32  print "reading all " + numberOfFiles + " bagfiles in current directory: \n"
33  for f in listOfBagFiles:
34  print f
35  print "\n press ctrl+c in the next 10 seconds to cancel \n"
36  time.sleep(10)
37 else:
38  print "bad argument(s): " + str(sys.argv) #shouldnt really come up
39  sys.exit(1)
40 
41 count = 0
42 for bagFile in listOfBagFiles:
43  count += 1
44  print "reading file " + str(count) + " of " + numberOfFiles + ": " + bagFile
45  #access bag
46  bag = rosbag.Bag(bagFile)
47  bagContents = bag.read_messages()
48  bagName = bag.filename
49 
50 
51  #create a new directory
52  folder = string.rstrip(bagName, ".bag")
53  try: #else already exists
54  os.makedirs(folder)
55  except:
56  pass
57  shutil.copyfile(bagName, folder + '/' + bagName)
58 
59 
60  #get list of topics from the bag
61  listOfTopics = []
62  for topic, msg, t in bagContents:
63  if topic not in listOfTopics:
64  listOfTopics.append(topic)
65 
66 
67  for topicName in listOfTopics:
68  #Create a new CSV file for each topic
69  filename = folder + '/' + string.replace(topicName, '/', '_slash_') + '.csv'
70  with open(filename, 'w+') as csvfile:
71  filewriter = csv.writer(csvfile, delimiter = ',')
72  firstIteration = True #allows header row
73  for subtopic, msg, t in bag.read_messages(topicName): # for each instant in time that has data for topicName
74  #parse data from this instant, which is of the form of multiple lines of "Name: value\n"
75  # - put it in the form of a list of 2-element lists
76  msgString = str(msg)
77  msgList = string.split(msgString, '\n')
78  instantaneousListOfData = []
79  for nameValuePair in msgList:
80  splitPair = string.split(nameValuePair, ':')
81  for i in range(len(splitPair)): #should be 0 to 1
82  splitPair[i] = string.strip(splitPair[i])
83  instantaneousListOfData.append(splitPair)
84  #write the first row from the first element of each pair
85  if firstIteration: # header
86  headers = ["rosbagTimestamp"] #first column header
87  for pair in instantaneousListOfData:
88  headers.append(pair[0])
89  filewriter.writerow(headers)
90  firstIteration = False
91  # write the value from each pair to the file
92  values = [str(t)] #first column will have rosbag timestamp
93  for pair in instantaneousListOfData:
94  if len(pair) > 1:
95  values.append(pair[1])
96  filewriter.writerow(values)
97  bag.close()
98 print "Done reading all " + numberOfFiles + " bag files."
